full_text:
IN THE COURT OF THE JUDICIAL FIRST CLASS MAGISTRATE-I,
THIRUVANANTHAPURAM
Present:-Smt. Karthika S Varma, Judicial First Class Magistrate-I, Thiruvananthapuram
Dated this the 18" day of February 2025
C.P. No. 18/2024
Complainant : State-Represented by the Sub Inspector of Police, Karamana Police Station in
Crime No. 800/2024
(By Assistant Public Prosecutor)
Accused : Vishakh @Achu, aged 22 years, S/o.Vijayan, resident of TC 23/1366,
Pandaravilakam, near Popular Service Centre, Thycadu, from Vijaya Bhavan,
thottinkara, Pallichal, Kundaratheri ward, Pallichal village
(By Advocate Shri. Kulathoor L R Rahul)
Offences : U/Ss.341, 294(b), 324 and 308 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860
Sentence/Order : The case against the accused is committed to the Hon'ble Court of Sessions,
Thiruvananthapuram U/s.209(a) of Cr.P.C.
This case having come up for consideration before this Court on 28.10.2024 and the court
passed the following:-
ORDER
1. This is a case wherein Charge Sheet was filed by the Sub Inspector of Police, Karamana Police
Station in Crime No. 800/2024 against the accused alleging commission of offences punishable
u/Ss.341, 294(b), 324 and 308 of the Indian Penal Code, 1860.
2. The Prosecution case is that on 28.06.2024 at about 18:30 hours, at Melarannoor, the Petitioner
herein uttered obscene words to the Informant and pushed him as a result of animosity towards him for
having talked ill about the former’s wife, and he attempted to inflict injury on his head by using a
machette (OQ1S}4@0)l) kept for clearing bushes which, when obstructed by the Informant using his
hand, he sustained injury cut wound on front portion on his head on the left side. Had the Informant not
restrained the attempt of the Petitioner with his hand, he would have sustained injury on his head that
could’ve resulted in his death. The Petitioner chased the Informant who ran, and inflicted cut wound on
the back side of his neck with the bottom portion of the machette (OUS BOOIMJOS AIS’ BIWNo).
Thereby the Petitioner is alleged to have committed the above offences.
3. The Accused is enlarged on bail in this case. Copies of all relevant Prosecution records were
furnished to him and thereby the mandate u/s. 207 of Cr.P.C. was complied with.
4. From the perusal of the records, the case is one which is exclusively triable by the Hon'ble
Court of Sessions. Since the offences alleged against the Accused involve offences exclusively triable

2 of 2

by the Hon'ble Court of Sessions, this case is therefore committed to the Hon'ble Court of
Sessions, Thiruvananthapuram as provided U/s.209(a) Cr.P.C. Accused is on bail. He shall appear
before that court on getting summons.
5. The Accused shall appear before the Hon’ble Court of Sessions, Thiruvananthapuram as
and when required. The entire case records including the documents and material objects shall be
forwarded to the Hon’ble Court of Sessions, Thiruvananthapuram at the earliest, subject to Rule
77(2) of the Criminal Rules of Practice, Kerala.
6. Notify the Learned Assistant Public Prosecutor as to the committal of the above case to the
Hon’ble Court of Sessions U/s.209(d) of Code of Criminal Procedure, 1973.
7. The office is directed to keep certified copies of all relevant records prior to the same being
send to the Hon'ble Court of Sessions.
(Dictated to the Confidential Assistant, transcribed and typed by her, corrected and pronounced by
me in open Court on this the 18" day of February, 2025.)

Judicial First Class Magistrate-I,

Thiruvananthapuram
